intro: Micropholis guyanensis subsp. duckeana, commonly known as the Guyana micropholis, is a species of flowering plant in the family Sapotaceae. It is native to the rainforests of South America, particularly in regions of Guyana and northern Brazil. The plant is a small to medium-sized tree, typically reaching heights of up to 20 meters. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and elliptical in shape, with a leathery texture. The fruit is a small, fleshy drupe that contains a single seed, and it plays a role in the dispersal of the species by animals.
